ent.origin: Middle English: from Old French elefant, via Latin from Greek elephas, elephant- 'ivory, elephant'.

p.def: A very large plant-eating mammal with a prehensile trunk, long curved ivory tusks, and large ears, native to Africa and southern Asia. It is the largest living land animal.
p.eg: The sale of new ivory was banned in 1989 to curb the slaughter of elephants in Africa.
